column4: anyone knows how to uninstall stuff installed with distutils??
manually :/
manually as ain search for all the installed stuff?
will that do ?
yes, in general distutils does not provide an uninstall command
is there no better way?
if the installer doesn't hack uninstall onto it
can u do that\?
what is the package?
http://trac.umitproject.org/wiki/PacketManipulator
try 'sudo uninstall_umit'
you mean "./setup.py uninstall_umit "??
no, it appears to have installed an uninstall_umit script
it doesnt work
can you be more specific?
bash: uninstall_umit: command not found
I can get the PacketManipulator installed. The problem is it doesnt install the plugins. So, I am trying to reinstall it.
I guess it didn't install properly then, xplaining the missing uninstaller
How did you know about the uninstaller?
I looked at the setup.py on their source code browsser: http://trac.umitproject.org/browser/trunk/setup.py
I am not installing the complete package umit. I am installing only PacketManipulator
http://trac.umitproject.org/browser/branch/PacketManipulator
no uninstall script for that one, but nearly everything seems to be installed to /usr/lib/python2.5/site-packages/PM/
Thank u very much..... I'll look into it
